model
Class Player

java.lang.Object
  java.util.Observable
      model.Player

public class Player
extends java.util.Observable

A Player object represents a player in a Yahtzee game. The player has a name, a Strategy object, a ScoreCard object, and a cumulative score. The Player object extends Observabele.

Version:
2.0.1 2/2/2012
Author:
Aaron Lamb

Constructor Detail

Player

public Player(java.lang.String name,
              Strategy strategy)
The constructor for a Player object

Parameters:
name - The player's name
strategy - The Strategy object for the player
Method Detail

takeTurn

public void takeTurn()
Initiates a turn for the player. This method must be called at the start of a turn by the Game object, or the Strategy will not take the appropriate turn.

takeScore

public java.lang.Boolean takeScore(Hands hand,
                                   int score)
Records the score for the given hand.

Parameters:
hand - The hand to score
score - The score for the hand
Returns:
true if the score is recorded, false if it cannot be recorded (if the score is already taken it cannot be taken a second time).
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the hand passed is null

incrementScore

public void incrementScore(int score)
Increments the Player's cumulative score. The final score for the most recent game should be passed to this method in order to track cumulative scores.

Parameters:
score -

resetScoreCard

public void resetScoreCard()
Resets the scorecard for the player. Should be called when starting a new game.

resetScore

public void resetScore()
Resets the cumulative score to 0. Should be called when resetting the game.

markFirst

public void markFirst()
Marks a player as the first player in a game

isFirst

public java.lang.Boolean isFirst()
Returns whether a player is the first playing in the game (true) or not (false)

Returns:
true if the player is the first player in the game

getScoreCard

public ScoreCard getScoreCard()
Getter for the Player's ScoreCard.

Returns:
a deep clone of the Player's ScoreCard

the Player's name

the strategy name for the player

equals

public boolean equals(java.lang.Object other)
